translations.text: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:<sup foot_note="182755">1</sup>
(O Prophet), your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased.<sup foot_note="182756">1</sup>
Indeed what is to come will be better for you than what has gone by.<sup foot_note="182757">1</sup>
Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well-pleased.<sup foot_note="182758">1</sup>
Did He not find you an orphan and then gave you shelter?<sup foot_note="182759">1</sup>
Did He not find you unaware of the Right Way, and then directed you to it?<sup foot_note="182760">1</sup>
And did He not find you in want, and then enriched you?<sup foot_note="182761">1</sup>
Therefore, be not harsh with the orphan;<sup foot_note="182762">1</sup>
and chide not him who asks,<sup foot_note="182763">1</sup>
and proclaim the bounty of your Lord.<sup foot_note="182764">1</sup>
